channel.title: About on Shane Reilly
channel.description: Recent content in About on Shane Reilly

item.title: About
item.description: About Me I’m a third year computer science major at the University of Cincinnati. I’m interested in reverse engineering, binary exploitation, cryptography, electronics, software-defined radio and a myriad of other topics. In my free time I enjoy solving security capture-the-flag challenges, Brazillian jiu-jitsu and playing guitar. Skills reverse engineering, ghidra, c, c++, wireshark, electronics, gdb, x86/x86-64, arm, network protocols, python, shell scripting, linux Contact : Cincinnati, OH : reillysp@mail.

item.title: Co-op Experiences
item.description: Co-op Experiences Radiance Technologies January 2020 - May 2020 Reverse Engineer Co-op During this co-op rotation, my primary duties consisted of developing Ghidra plugins and other tools to analyze binary complexity. I gained a great deal of familiarity with the Java programming language and delved deep into algorithmic methods of analyzing binaries. I also received a Top Secret security clearance and improved my ability to write technical documentations. Skills used:

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects My personal website. I post capture-the-flag writeups, and other things I find interesting. I made it using the static-site generator Hugo. In making the site, I learned a great deal about HTML/CSS, JavaScript, FTP, hosting, and may other topics related to web development. In participating in capture-the-flag challenges, I learned about various security topics. Involvement Boone County Water Rescue July 2020 - June 2020 Diver Paricipated in rescue operations, recoveries and seaches in the Ohio River and Northern Kentucky waterways.

item.title: Summative Reflection
item.description: Reflection After serving over five years in the Marine Corps, I was ready to take on new challenges. I was accepted into the University of Cincinnati where I started pursuing a degree in Computer Science. In January 2020, I started my first co-op at Radiance Technologies in Beavercreek, OH. I returned there in September 2020 for my second rotation. The co-op program has helped further both my technical and interpersonal skills.
